Package edu.missouri.phys

Class MotionState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mmkrusniak.phys.MotionState
  • public class MotionState
extends java.lang.Object
    There are a number of convenience getters and setters that manage specific components of motion, enough that I won't document them individually, but they follow a pretty clear naming convention: i.e., x() and setX() manage the first dimension of position, velY() and setVelY() manage the second dimension of velocity, accN() and setAccN() manage the nth dimension of acceleration, etc.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  MotionState.MotionType
      Defines three types of drone motion useful when calculating energy usage.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MotionState

        public MotionState​(int dim,
                   int depth)
        Initializes a motion model in dim dimensions up to the (depth-1)th derivative of motion. In 2020, REU drone work only analyzed drone motion up to depth 3 (acceleration), which was sufficient to match empirical behavior but could be improved. Practically speaking dim is not greater than 3, although it is conceivable that heading could be encoded as an additional dimension instead of the static version currently used (which is more convenient but less descriptive), and indeed, some older parts of this code may still use that convention in sngle points.
        Parameters:
        dim - Number of dimensions of motion to model.
        depth - Number of derivatives of motion to model (position only is 1, position and velocity is 2, etc)

      • MotionState

        public MotionState​(Point start,
                   int depth)
        Initializes a motion model with (depth-1) derivatives of motion and a number of dimensions according to a starting point. The state is initialized with that specified starting location.
        Parameters:
        start - A starting location; its number of dimensions specifies the dimension of the model.
        depth - Number of derivatives of motion to model (position only is 1, position and velocity is 2, etc)

    • Method Detail

      • advance

        public void advance​(double t)
        Advances the motion model t simulation seconds into the future. The simulation is discrete with time-steps of t, although some interpolation is performed. (If you find that drones are skipping or spinning over target points, consider taking a close look at this section.) This applies physics, such that each level of motion gains the level one above it (position gains velocity, velocity gains acceleration, etc.) Drag is also applied here. Finally, the motion is interpolated to determine which motion listeners should be triggered.
        Parameters:
        t - The number of simulation seconds by which to advance the motion.

      • getLocation

        public Point getLocation()
        Returns the location (in all dimensions) currently represented by the motion state.
        Returns:
        The location represented by the motion state.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation​(Point p)
        Sets the location (in as many dimensions as the input) represented by the motion state.
        Parameters:
        p - A new location for the motion state.

      • set

        public void set​(int deriv,
                int var,
                double value)
        Sets an arbitrary component of the motion state in the (deriv-1)th derivative and the (var)th dimension. If either the specified dimension or derivative are not tracked, an error is thrown.
        Parameters:
        deriv - The level of motion to modify.
        var - The dimension of motion to modify.
        value - The new value for the specified component of motion.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either the specified dimension or derivative are not tracked.

      • get

        public double get​(int deriv,
                  int var)
        Yields an arbitrary component of the motion state in the (deriv-1)th derivative and the (var)th dimension. If either the specified dimension or derivative are not tracked, an error is thrown.
        Parameters:
        deriv - The level of motion to get.
        var - The dimension of motion to get.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either the specified dimension or derivative are not tracked.

      • setHeading

        public void setHeading​(double heading)
        Sets the XY heading of the motion state, which for the convenience of this project is tracked independently of the rest of the motion state.
        Parameters:
        heading - A new heading.

      • getHeading

        public double getHeading()
        Gives the XY heading of the motion state, which for the convenience of this project is tracked independently of the rest of the motion state.
        Returns:
        The current XY heading represented by the motion state.

      • setAcc2D

        public void setAcc2D​(double direction,
                     double magnitude)
        Convenience method which sets the XY acceleration represented by the state in a direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - A direction of XY motion, in radians.
        magnitude - A magnitude of XY acceleration.

      • setVel2D

        public void setVel2D​(double direction,
                     double magnitude)
        Convenience method which sets the XY velocity represented by the state in a direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - A direction of XY motion, in radians.
        magnitude - A magnitude of XY velocity.

      • addListener

        public void addListener​(Point p,
                        double dist,
                        java.util.function.Consumer<Point> action)
        Adds a listener to the motion state. When the state gets within dist XYZ distance of the given point, the action is triggered and removed.
        Parameters:
        p - Any point in the same number of dimensions as the motion state.
        dist - Some distance from the point at which to trigger the action.
        action - An action (which is given the current location of the state as an argument) to execute.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gives the motion state as a string, showcasing its current components.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The motion state as a string.

      • vel2D

        public double vel2D()
        Convenience function which gives the total XY velocity.
        Returns:
        The XY velocity represented by the motion state.

      • acc2D

        public double acc2D()
        Convenience function which gives the total XY acceleration.
        Returns:
        The XY acceleration represented by the motion state.

      • getCurrentMotion

        public MotionState.MotionType getCurrentMotion()
        Gives the current type of motion represented by the motion state: accelerating, deccelerating, or constant. This is convenient for energy calculations.
        Returns:
        The current type of motion of the motion state.
